subject: Politics
title: Taxes and Redistribution
description: A quick win: understand Taxes and Redistribution.

hook.text: Warren Buffett pays a lower tax rate than his secretary. That's not a glitch â€” it's the system working as designed.

buildup.text: Progressive taxation charges higher earners more. Redistribution transfers resources from rich to poor.

discovery.text: After World War II, the US top tax rate hit 91%. Inequality fell and the middle class boomed.

twist.text: Since the 1980s, top tax rates fell worldwide. Wealth shifted upward as governments cut taxes on the rich.

climax.text: Tax havens drain $600 billion yearly from government coffers. The global tax system leaks like a sieve.

punchline.text: Tax policy decides who prospers. It's the most political choice a nation makes.

quiz.question: What happened to US inequality when the top tax rate was 91%?
options: Inequality fell and the middle class grew
